intro: Weingartia pucarensis, commonly known as the Pucará cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for succulent collections.
